intro: Harveya kiangombensis, commonly known as the Bhutanese bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
